NODE_TEXT:
MOOG ID No.:CB40859-001 Date:11/2020

# 11 Alarms & warnings

# 11.6.17.2 Error 16-2 (emergency code 8400h)

Cause: Current speed above maximum speed of motor > 120%

# Suggested steps:

- Check your parameter data set

The control system failed to track the reference value

- Please check if the axis is blocked.
- Try to reduce acceleration or deceleration.
- If reference speed is higher than the motor rated speed, please check field weakening settings. In field-weakening range, the available torque per current is reduced.

The speed control might run away, most likely due to a wrong encoder offset.

- Please check that the encoder offset is set properly.
- If auto commutation is used, re-view the auto commutation setting and test under all possible conditions.
- If torque mode is used, reduce torque, ensure external speed limitation, or increase speed control gain for stronger limitation.

This is possibly an EMC issue. This is very likely if the problem occurs when switching on motor control and/or when connecting DC link power supply.

- Please check the device cabling for proper connection.
- Please check device grounding, i.e. the connection to a metal backplane and cabinet connection to earth.
- Check motor grounding and motor cable length.

# 11 Alarms & warnings

# MOOG

ID No.: CB40859-001 Date: 11/2020

# MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp

# 11.6.18 Error 17: Position difference error

# 11.6.18.1 Error 17-1 (emergency code 8611h)

Cause: Position tracking error too large

Suggested steps:

- Check your parameter P743
- The control system failed to track the reference value
- Please check if the axis is blocked.
- Try to reduce acceleration or deceleration.
Q: What is the cause of Error 16-2 (emergency code 8400h) in the MOOG MSD ServoDrive?
A1: The cause is current speed exceeding 120% of the motor's maximum speed.
A2: Error 16-2 occurs when the current speed is above 120% of the motor's maximum speed.
A3: It happens due to the current speed surpassing the motor's maximum speed by more than 120%.
A4: The error is triggered by the motor operating at a speed that's over 120% of its maximum rated speed.
A5: Exceeding the motor's maximum speed by more than 120% causes Error 16-2.

Q: What are the suggested steps to resolve Error 16-2 in the MOOG MSD ServoDrive?
A1: Check the parameter data set, ensure the axis isn't blocked, reduce acceleration or deceleration, and verify field weakening settings if the reference speed exceeds the motor rated speed.
A2: Steps include checking the parameter data set, inspecting for axis blockage, adjusting acceleration or deceleration, and reviewing field weakening settings for high reference speeds.
A3: To fix, examine the parameter data, check for axis blockages, lower acceleration or deceleration rates, and assess field weakening settings when necessary.
A4: Solutions involve verifying parameter data, ensuring the axis moves freely, reducing acceleration or deceleration, and checking field weakening for speeds above the motor's rated speed.
A5: Address by reviewing parameter settings, checking axis freedom, adjusting acceleration or deceleration, and evaluating field weakening if speed is too high.

Q: What role does field weakening play in the MOOG MSD ServoDrive's operation?
A1: Field weakening allows operation above the motor's rated speed but reduces available torque per current.
A2: It enables speeds beyond the motor's rated speed, at the cost of lower torque per current.
A3: Field weakening is used for higher speeds, decreasing the torque available per current unit.
A4: This technique supports exceeding the motor's rated speed, though with diminished torque per current.
A5: Field weakening facilitates operation at speeds above the rated, albeit with reduced torque efficiency.
